content:
衛生福利部民國107年7月20日 衛部秘字第1072161286號通知單註銷密等
It is perhaps hardly necessary for me to mention that the establish- ment of a National Salmonella Centre and a National Shigella Centre is only one of the activities that a country will develop to Investigate, prevent, and treat salmonella and Shigella infections, General sanitary and health measures would naturally constitute the main programme, of which the laboratory services provided by these Centres are only one useful component. I am, of course, giving due consideration to the development of the other aspecte of work directed against these infections.
I would be grateful if you would be kind enough to forward me the name or names of the laboratory or laboratories which may now be serving as your National Salmonella Centre and National Shigella Centre for the purposes outlined in the sttached Annex. If no laboratory has yet been selected and appointed by your Government for these purposed, may I venture to suggestc thet your Government might consider whether it is yet in a position to.make Buchca selection, in which case I should be'gled if you would forward to the, . in due course, the name or names of the laboratory or laboratories so appointed. When I have received from you the names either of your existing National Salmonella Centre and National Shigella Centre, or of those which you are now in a position to appoint as such, I will transmit the information to the appropriate International Centres so that direct relations between them and your National Centres may be either reinforced or established, as the case may require.
I trust that the suggestions and observations of pages 15 to 19 of the Annex, under the heading of "Selection and Appointment of National Centres", will be helpful to you in considering the selection of laboratories to serve as your National Salmonella and National Shigella Centres. Among other points you will note the important reasons given on page 15 for the selection of only one officially recognized National Salmonella Centre and only one National Shigella Centre respectively, and not several of each in any one country. Reasons are also given for anticipating that, in many countries, it will be found expedient both for the National Salmonella Centre and the National Shigella Centre to be housed in a single institution.
On page 20 of the Annex it is stressed that satisfactory relations between the International Centres and National Centres can be established only if the latter are staffed by skilled bacteriologists. It is, of course, fully appreciated that many countries may not yet be in a position to meet this requirement, and you will perhaps allow me to draw your attention to the observation that in any such country it would be advisable for the designation or appointment of a National Centre to be deterred until the Centre can, in fact, bo staffed by akilled bacter- iologists. Certain suggestions towards improving the position in regard to avail- ability of suitably qualified enteric bacteriologists appear on page 20 of the Amex, under the heading of "Consultant Services and Training Facilities".
With regard to the links between the National Centres and the Inter- nationel Centres, you will note that it is envisaged that the National Salmonella Centres of all countries will be directly related to the International Salmonell and Mecheriobla Centre, Copenhagen. National Shigella Centres, however, will be related either to the International Shigella Centre, Atlanta, or to the Inter- national Shigella Centre, London, according to thepreference of each Member State. When sending me the names of your National Salmonella Centre and National Shigella Oentre would you also inform me at the same time, whether you wish the direct link of your National Shigella Centre to be with the International Shigella Centre of Atlanta or of London. This selection will be dependent upon a number of technical and administrative factor on WAlow I suggest you will find it helpful to consult your Regional Director.
I have the honour to be,
Sir,
Your cbedient Servant. (Sgd)
for M. G. Candau, M. D. Director General.
KB
Academia Historica
45

Your cbedient Servant.

for M. G. Candau, M. D.
